result.markdown:
---
title: "More about dplyr and dbplyr"
execute: 
  eval: true
  freeze: true
---




## Data collection
*Understand the difference between printing and collecting*

0. Catch up


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(dplyr)
library(dbplyr)
library(DBI)

con <- dbConnect(
  odbc::databricks(),
  HTTPPath = "/sql/1.0/warehouses/300bd24ba12adf8e"
)

tbl_diamonds <- tbl(con, "diamonds")
```
:::



1. Call the `tbl_diamonds` variable directly


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tbl_diamonds
#> # Source:   table<`diamonds`> [?? x 11]
#> # Database: Spark SQL 3.1.1[token@Spark SQL/hive_metastore]
#>    `_c0` carat cut       color clarity depth table price     x     y     z
#>    <int> <dbl> <chr>     <chr> <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1     1  0.23 Ideal     E     SI2      61.5    55   326  3.95  3.98  2.43
#>  2     2  0.21 Premium   E     SI1      59.8    61   326  3.89  3.84  2.31
#>  3     3  0.23 Good      E     VS1      56.9    65   327  4.05  4.07  2.31
#>  4     4  0.29 Premium   I     VS2      62.4    58   334  4.2   4.23  2.63
#>  5     5  0.31 Good      J     SI2      63.3    58   335  4.34  4.35  2.75
#>  6     6  0.24 Very Good J     VVS2     62.8    57   336  3.94  3.96  2.48
#>  7     7  0.24 Very Good I     VVS1     62.3    57   336  3.95  3.98  2.47
#>  8     8  0.26 Very Good H     SI1      61.9    55   337  4.07  4.11  2.53
#>  9     9  0.22 Fair      E     VS2      65.1    61   337  3.87  3.78  2.49
#> 10    10  0.23 Very Good H     VS1      59.4    61   338  4     4.05  2.39
#> # ℹ more rows
```
:::


2. Call `tbl_diamonds` via `print()`.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
print(tbl_diamonds)
#> # Source:   table<`diamonds`> [?? x 11]
#> # Database: Spark SQL 3.1.1[token@Spark SQL/hive_metastore]
#>    `_c0` carat cut       color clarity depth table price     x     y     z
#>    <int> <dbl> <chr>     <chr> <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1     1  0.23 Ideal     E     SI2      61.5    55   326  3.95  3.98  2.43
#>  2     2  0.21 Premium   E     SI1      59.8    61   326  3.89  3.84  2.31
#>  3     3  0.23 Good      E     VS1      56.9    65   327  4.05  4.07  2.31
#>  4     4  0.29 Premium   I     VS2      62.4    58   334  4.2   4.23  2.63
#>  5     5  0.31 Good      J     SI2      63.3    58   335  4.34  4.35  2.75
#>  6     6  0.24 Very Good J     VVS2     62.8    57   336  3.94  3.96  2.48
#>  7     7  0.24 Very Good I     VVS1     62.3    57   336  3.95  3.98  2.47
#>  8     8  0.26 Very Good H     SI1      61.9    55   337  4.07  4.11  2.53
#>  9     9  0.22 Fair      E     VS2      65.1    61   337  3.87  3.78  2.49
#> 10    10  0.23 Very Good H     VS1      59.4    61   338  4     4.05  2.39
#> # ℹ more rows
```
:::


3. Call `tbl_diamonds` via `collect()`. Notice it prints the **entire** table 


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
collect(tbl_diamonds)
#> # A tibble: 53,940 × 11
#>    `_c0` carat cut       color clarity depth table price     x     y     z
#>    <int> <dbl> <chr>     <chr> <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1     1  0.23 Ideal     E     SI2      61.5    55   326  3.95  3.98  2.43
#>  2     2  0.21 Premium   E     SI1      59.8    61   326  3.89  3.84  2.31
#>  3     3  0.23 Good      E     VS1      56.9    65   327  4.05  4.07  2.31
#>  4     4  0.29 Premium   I     VS2      62.4    58   334  4.2   4.23  2.63
#>  5     5  0.31 Good      J     SI2      63.3    58   335  4.34  4.35  2.75
#>  6     6  0.24 Very Good J     VVS2     62.8    57   336  3.94  3.96  2.48
#>  7     7  0.24 Very Good I     VVS1     62.3    57   336  3.95  3.98  2.47
#>  8     8  0.26 Very Good H     SI1      61.9    55   337  4.07  4.11  2.53
#>  9     9  0.22 Fair      E     VS2      65.1    61   337  3.87  3.78  2.49
#> 10    10  0.23 Very Good H     VS1      59.4    61   338  4     4.05  2.39
#> # ℹ 53,930 more rows
```
:::


4. Load the previous operation to a variable named `local_diamonds`


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
local_diamonds <- collect(tbl_diamonds)
```
:::


5. Use `pull()` to extract the values from `price` only


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tbl_diamonds %>% 
  pull(price)
```
:::


6. Load the previous operation to a variable named `price`. Notice that this time,
the variable is a vector, not a data frame.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
price <- tbl_diamonds %>% 
  pull(price)
```
:::


## Referring to non-default catalog tables
*Using I() to create non-default table references*

1. Create a reference to the `customer` table, which is under the `tpch` schema, 
inside the `samples` catalog


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tbl(con, I("samples.tpch.customer"))
#> # Source:   table<samples.tpch.customer> [?? x 8]
#> # Database: Spark SQL 3.1.1[token@Spark SQL/hive_metastore]
#>    c_custkey c_name         c_address c_nationkey c_phone c_acctbal c_mktsegment
#>      <int64> <chr>          <chr>         <int64> <chr>       <dbl> <chr>       
#>  1    412445 Customer#0004… "0QAB3Oj…          21 31-421…     5358. BUILDING    
#>  2    412446 Customer#0004… "5u8MSby…          20 30-487…     9442. MACHINERY   
#>  3    412447 Customer#0004… "HC4ZT62…           7 17-797…     7869. AUTOMOBILE  
#>  4    412448 Customer#0004… "hJok1MM…           6 16-541…     6061. MACHINERY   
#>  5    412449 Customer#0004… "zAt1nZN…          14 24-710…     4974. HOUSEHOLD   
#>  6    412450 Customer#0004… "fUD6IoG…          20 30-293…     4406. BUILDING    
#>  7    412451 Customer#0004… "W2Ge0Qd…          20 30-590…     2290. BUILDING    
#>  8    412452 Customer#0004… "Ij4xiPI…          10 20-492…     3427. AUTOMOBILE  
#>  9    412453 Customer#0004… "4DmSxDP…          21 31-480…     4592. MACHINERY   
#> 10    412454 Customer#0004… "ZQfKDMU…           9 19-898…     2036. FURNITURE   
#> # ℹ more rows
#> # ℹ 1 more variable: c_comment <chr>
```
:::


2. Create a reference to the `sales_order_in_la` table, under the `ferit` schema


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tbl(con, I("ferit.sales_order_in_la"))
#> # Source:   table<ferit.sales_order_in_la> [?? x 7]
#> # Database: Spark SQL 3.1.1[token@Spark SQL/hive_metastore]
#>    order_date city        customer_id customer_name      currency sales quantity
#>    <date>     <chr>       <chr>       <chr>              <chr>    <int>  <int64>
#>  1 2019-09-27 Los Angeles 14120673    DEL MONICO,  DOMI… USD       1166        2
#>  2 2019-08-30 Los Angeles 12593702    SAUTKUS,  LAURA    USD       1250        8
#>  3 2019-11-12 Los Angeles 14159223    ROBERTS,  ALAN E   USD         98        2
#>  4 2019-10-15 Los Angeles 13005776    SAUTKUS,  LAURA    USD        731        4
#>  5 2019-08-23 Los Angeles 14501552    osborn paper co    USD       2180        3
#>  6 2019-09-03 Los Angeles 13265811    RYCHTANEK,  NICOLE USD         72        3
#>  7 2019-10-16 Los Angeles 12947406    epikos church      USD       2529        3
#>  8 2019-08-08 Los Angeles 15171127    GORZEN,  WALDEMAR… USD       1207        6
#>  9 2019-08-16 Los Angeles 14065091    VARGAS,  DAVID     USD        349        2
#> 10 2019-10-08 Los Angeles 13999146    SEGOVIA,  VICTOR M USD       2092        5
#> # ℹ more rows
```
:::
